description: Indicates whether the specified Config rules are compliant. If a rule is noncompliant, this operation returns the number of Amazon Web Services resources that do not comply with the rule. A rule is compliant if all of the evaluated resources comply with it. It is noncompliant if any of these resources do not comply. If Config has no current evaluation results for the rule, it returns INSUFFICIENT_DATA. This result might indicate one of the following conditions:

parameters.name: ConfigRuleNames
parameters.description: Specify one or more Config rule names to filter the results by rule. (string) ---

nested_items.name: ComplianceByConfigRules
nested_items.description: Indicates whether each of the specified Config rules is compliant.

nested_items.name: ConfigRuleName
nested_items.description: The name of the Config rule.

nested_items.name: Compliance
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the Config rule is compliant.

nested_items.name: ComplianceType
nested_items.description: Indicates whether an Amazon Web Services resource or Config rule is compliant.

nested_items.name: ComplianceContributorCount
nested_items.description: The number of Amazon Web Services resources or Config rules that cause a result of NON_COMPLIANT, up to a maximum number.

nested_items.name: CappedCount
nested_items.description: The number of Amazon Web Services resources or Config rules responsible for the current compliance of the item.

nested_items.name: CapExceeded
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the maximum count is reached.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The string that you use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response.
